means: 假装，掩饰（感情、意图等）( dissemble的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She was a very honest person who was incapable of dissembling.
sentence.Network_cn: 她是一个非常诚实的人，不会伪装。

sentence.Network_en: Dissembling enough, he was not sufficiently oily and make - believe.
sentence.Network_cn: 他虽是虚伪极了,可还是油滑的不够, 假装的不够.

sentence.Network_en: You've lost the art of dissembling in four years on this island.
sentence.Network_cn: 在岛上住了四年,你已经失去掩饰思想感情的本领.

Perhaps it was right to dissemble your love ., 为掩饰你的爱 , 那也许是对的.

entry.def: When people dissemble, they hide their real intentions or emotions.

example.ex: Henry was not slow to dissemble when it served his purposes.
example.tran: 在需要时，亨利会毫不迟疑地伪装自己。

means.word_mean: 1. concealing under a false appearance with the intent to deceive;

auth_sentence.content: Straightforward and moralistic, he admitted misdeeds and avoided dissembling.
auth_sentence.res_content: Straightforward and moralistic, he admitted misdeeds and avoided dissembling.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Straightforward and moralistic, he admitted misdeeds and avoided dissembling.

auth_sentence.content: The rages, the slamming doors, the silences, the dissembling.

auth_sentence.content: No more dissembling, no more lawyerly evasions.
